title: The NHS is failing cancer patients by failing to trust them
text:
Our health service must become more patient-centric

People may call me “brave” for facing cancer twice before the age of 35, but nothing terrifies me more than the latest research from Breast Cancer Now. When breast cancer spreads, one in four patients must visit a GP three or more times for a diagnosis, the charity has found. This unacceptable wait means cancer is likely more advanced, and, crucially, less treatable by the time it is diagnosed. With 10,000 people dying every year due to diagnosis barriers, the health system needs to go back to basics: listen and trust patients.
